Package space.sunqian.common.base.random

Interface Rng

All Superinterfaces:
DoubleSupplier, IntSupplier, LongSupplier
public interface Rng extends IntSupplier, LongSupplier, DoubleSupplier
The Random Number Generator, base interface to produce random numbers. It extends the IntSupplier, LongSupplier and DoubleSupplier, to supply random int, long and double values.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    default @Nonnull DoubleStream
    doubles()
    Returns a new unlimited DoubleStream that produces random double values in the range [0.0, 1.0).
    default @Nonnull DoubleStream
    doubles(double startInclusive, double endExclusive)
    Returns a new unlimited DoubleStream that produces random double values in the range [startInclusive, endExclusive).
    default @Nonnull DoubleStream
    doubles(long size)
    Returns a new DoubleStream that produces random double values in the range [0.0, 1.0), and the stream size is limited by the given size.

    doubles(long size, double startInclusive, double endExclusive)

    static @Nonnull Rng
    secure(@Nonnull String algorithm)
    Returns a Rng instance based on the SecureRandom with the specified random algorithm.
    static @Nonnull Rng
    threadLocal()
    Returns a Rng instance based on the ThreadLocalRandom, and it is thread-safe and its reset(long) has no effect.

    • threadLocal

      @Nonnull static @Nonnull Rng threadLocal()
      Returns a Rng instance based on the ThreadLocalRandom, and it is thread-safe and its reset(long) has no effect.
      Returns:
      a Rng instance based on the ThreadLocalRandom

    • secure

      @Nonnull static @Nonnull Rng secure(@Nonnull @Nonnull String algorithm) throws UnsupportedOperationException
      Returns a Rng instance based on the SecureRandom with the specified random algorithm. This method is equivalent to: 
      
 try {
     SecureRandom secureRandom = SecureRandom.getInstance(algorithm);
     return Rng.newRng(secureRandom);
 } catch (NoSuchAlgorithmException e) {
     throw new UnsupportedOperationException(e);
 }
      Parameters:
      algorithm - the specified random algorithm
      Returns:
      a Rng instance based on the SecureRandom with the specified random algorithm
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - if the specified algorithm is unsupported
      See Also:
      • SecureRandom.getInstance(String)

      Resets a random seed for this Rng.

    • nextInt

      int nextInt()
      Returns the next random int value.
      Returns:
      the next random int value

    • nextInt

      int nextInt(int startInclusive, int endExclusive) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Returns the next random int value in the range [startInclusive, endExclusive). If startInclusive == endExclusive, then startInclusive is returned.

      Note that if this method needs to be invoked multiple times, it is recommended to use ints or intSupplier to reduce overhead.

      Parameters:
      startInclusive - the start value inclusive
      endExclusive - the end value exclusive
      Returns:
      the next random int value in the range [startInclusive, endExclusive)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if startInclusive > endExclusive

    • nextLong

      long nextLong()
      Returns the next random long value.
      Returns:
      the next random long value

    • nextLong

      long nextLong(long startInclusive, long endExclusive) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Returns the next random long value in the range [startInclusive, endExclusive). If startInclusive == endExclusive, then startInclusive is returned.

      Note that if this method needs to be invoked multiple times, it is recommended to use longs or longSupplier to reduce overhead.

      Parameters:
      startInclusive - the start value inclusive
      endExclusive - the end value exclusive
      Returns:
      the next random long value in the range [startInclusive, endExclusive)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if startInclusive > endExclusive

    • nextFloat

      Returns the next random float value in the range [0.0, 1.0).
      Returns:
      the next random float value in the range [0.0, 1.0)

    • nextFloat

      float nextFloat(float startInclusive, float endExclusive) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Returns the next random float value in the range [startInclusive, endExclusive). If startInclusive == endExclusive, then startInclusive is returned.

      Note that if this method needs to be invoked multiple times, it is recommended to use doubles or doubleSupplier to reduce overhead.

      Parameters:
      startInclusive - the start value inclusive
      endExclusive - the end value exclusive
      Returns:
      the next random float value in the range [startInclusive, endExclusive)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if startInclusive > endExclusive

    • nextDouble

      Returns:
      the next random double value in the range [0.0, 1.0)

    • nextDouble

      double nextDouble(double startInclusive, double endExclusive) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Returns the next random double value in the range [startInclusive, endExclusive). If startInclusive == endExclusive, then startInclusive is returned.

      Note that if this method needs to be invoked multiple times, it is recommended to use doubles or doubleSupplier to reduce overhead.

      Parameters:
      startInclusive - the start value inclusive
      endExclusive - the end value exclusive
      Returns:
      the next random double value in the range [startInclusive, endExclusive)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if startInclusive > endExclusive

    • nextBytes

      default byte @Nonnull [] nextBytes(int length) throws NegativeArraySizeException
      Returns a new random byte array of the specified length.
      Parameters:
      length - the specified length of the array
      Returns:
      a new random byte array of the specified length
      Throws:
      NegativeArraySizeException - if length < 0

    • nextBytes

      default void nextBytes(byte @Nonnull [] bytes)
      Fills the specified byte array with random bytes.
      Parameters:
      bytes - the specified byte array

    • nextBytes

      default void nextBytes(byte @Nonnull [] bytes, int off, int len) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Fills the specified byte array with len random bytes, starting at the specified offset.
      Parameters:
      bytes - the specified byte array
      off - the specified offset
      len - the number of bytes to fill
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if off < 0 or len < 0 or off + len > bytes.length

    • nextBytes

      default void nextBytes(@Nonnull @Nonnull ByteBuffer bytes)
      Fills the specified byte buffer with random bytes. The buffer's position increments by the actual filled number.
      Parameters:
      bytes - the specified byte buffer

    • ints

      @Nonnull default @Nonnull IntStream ints()
      Returns a new unlimited IntStream that produces random int values.
      Returns:
      a new unlimited IntStream that produces random int values

    • ints

      @Nonnull default @Nonnull IntStream ints(int startInclusive, int endExclusive) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Returns a new unlimited IntStream that produces random int values in the range [startInclusive, endExclusive). If startInclusive == endExclusive, then startInclusive is always produced.
      Parameters:
      startInclusive - the start value inclusive
      endExclusive - the end value exclusive
      Returns:
      a new unlimited IntStream that produces random int values in the range [startInclusive, endExclusive)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if startInclusive > endExclusive

    • ints

      @Nonnull default @Nonnull IntStream ints(long size) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Returns a new IntStream that produces random int values, and the stream size is limited by the given size.
      Parameters:
      size - the given stream size
      Returns:
      a new IntStream that produces random int values, and the stream size is limited by the given size
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if size < 0

    • ints

      @Nonnull default @Nonnull IntStream ints(long size, int startInclusive, int endExclusive) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Returns a new IntStream that produces random int values in the range [startInclusive, endExclusive), and the stream size is limited by the given size. If startInclusive == endExclusive, then startInclusive is always produced.
      Parameters:
      size - the given stream size
      startInclusive - the start value inclusive
      endExclusive - the end value exclusive
      Returns:
      a new IntStream that produces random int values in the range [startInclusive, endExclusive), and the stream size is limited by the given size
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if size < 0 or startInclusive > endExclusive

      Returns a new IntSupplier that produces random int values.
      Returns:
      a new IntSupplier that produces random int values

    • intSupplier

      @Nonnull @Nonnull IntSupplier intSupplier(int startInclusive, int endExclusive) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Returns a new IntSupplier that produces random int value in the range: startInclusive <= value < endExclusive. If startInclusive == endExclusive, then startInclusive is always produced.
      Parameters:
      startInclusive - the start value inclusive
      endExclusive - the end value exclusive
      Returns:
      a new IntSupplier that produces random int value in the range: startInclusive <= value < endExclusive
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if startInclusive > endExclusive

      Parameters:

      endExclusive - the end value exclusive

    • longs

      @Nonnull default @Nonnull LongStream longs(long size, long startInclusive, long endExclusive) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Returns a new LongStream that produces random long values in the range [startInclusive, endExclusive), and the stream size is limited by the given size. If startInclusive == endExclusive, then startInclusive is always produced.
      Parameters:
      size - the given stream size
      startInclusive - the start value inclusive
      endExclusive - the end value exclusive
      Returns:

      IllegalArgumentException - if size < 0 or startInclusive > endExclusive

    • longSupplier

      LongSupplier longSupplier(long startInclusive, long endExclusive) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Returns a new LongSupplier that produces random long value in the range: startInclusive <= value < endExclusive. If startInclusive == endExclusive, then startInclusive is always produced.
      Parameters:
      startInclusive - the start value inclusive
      endExclusive - the end value exclusive
      Returns:
      a new LongSupplier that produces random long value in the range: startInclusive <= value < endExclusive
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if startInclusive > endExclusive

      @Nonnull @Nonnull DoubleSupplier doubleSupplier(double startInclusive, double endExclusive) throws IllegalArgumentException
